incidents.name: Issues with 1.1.1.1 public resolver

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating, an issue which potentially impacts multiple 1.1.1.1 public resolver users. Users might see increased latency and timeouts.

Further detail will be provided as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Access: Error "500" on Access protected domains

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Access: A subset of customer might observe unexpected "500" errors when reaching a small number of Access protected domains.
We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Zero Trust Posture failure

incident_updates.body: Every impacted device has now self-healed. This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

WARP Devices that were rebooted, registered, or rotated keys between July 22 2025 17:25 UTC and July 22 2025 20:00pm are impacted by this incident. Impacted customers can manually reboot their WARP Devices, or rotate keys, to recover. If no action is taken, WARP Devices will automatically self-heal within 24 hours.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Some WARP Devices may be failing to report posture status.

incidents.name: Delayed Cloudflare Access configuration updates

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare engineering is investigating an issue causing some Cloudflare Access configuration changes to be delayed. This would include application and policy configuration changes. Access authentication and policy enforcement are not impacted.  We are working to understand to mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Cloudflare lists API delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified the cause for this issue and applied a fix. We are currently monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with the API for URL lists, bulk redirect lists and hostname lists.

Customers using the dashboard or Cloudflare APIs may find that their changes have a significant delay before taking effect at the Cloudflare Edge.

These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.

incidents.name: Browser Isolation Issues

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare was investigating issues with the Browser Isolation service. Customers that use Browser Isolation may have seen a lowered maximum concurrent browsers limit whilst attempting to load sites through the service.  This issue did not affect any other Cloudflare services.

The issue was first seen today at 00:00 UTC and resolved at 08:24 UTC.

incidents.name: SOC alerting for Core Applications was impacted

incident_updates.body: On July 3, 2025, between 15:43 UTC and 20:10 UTC, customers may have experienced an impact to Cloudflare Core applications SOC alerting. This was due to an error encountered after a configuration update. The issue has been rectified, and all alerting is now functioning as expected with no ongoing impact.

Cloudflare is investigating potential connectivity issues related to unexpected DNS resolution for a subset of customers using China Network from some locations in China.

We are assessing impact and causes and will provide further updates as soon as possible.

incidents.name: R2 elevated errors during CompleteMultipart operations

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've deployed a fix for the multipart uploads that were failing on Complete Multipart calls, and error rates have returned to normal levels. We will continue monitoring impact.
We've isolated the pattern leading to Multipart Uploads that are erroring during CompleteMultipartUploads and are preparing a fix for those requests.

Cloudflare has observed an increase in HTTP 500 responses on some CompleteMultipart API requests containing parts uploaded between 21:03 and 21:26 UTC.  We are working to analyze and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.
